changes_summary: These commits primarily focus on implementing One-Time Purchase (OTP) functionality across multiple brands (Factor Form, Good Chop), with significant work on checkout flows, payment integration, and UI components. Additional changes include shipping price handling, UI refinements for Green Dish, contentful key additions for nutrition data, and various bug fixes and test improvements.

features.name: Factor Form OTP Integration
features.description: Complete one-time purchase flow including checkout type selection dialog, place order logic, and checkoutType parameter support

features.name: Two-Step Login for FactorForm
features.description: New login components for FactorForm with redirect logic for unregistered users from legacy to Shopify FactorForm

features.name: Good Chop OTP Cart Creation
features.description: Cart creation hook implementation for Good Chop one-time purchase flow with new banner copies for OTP variation users

features.name: Free Shipping Display
features.description: Returns 'FREE' label when actual shipping price is zero, with new Shipping interface in Price model

features.name: Green Dish Storage and Prep Steps
features.description: Implementation of storage and prep steps section with UI padding fixes and reactivation page improvements

features.name: Premium Shipping Migration
features.description: Migrates premium shipping functionality to Reactivation/Plan Summary pages

features.name: Nutrition Contentful Keys
features.description: Addition of new contentful keys for nutrition data and other content management

decisions.what: Introduce Shipping interface into Price model
decisions.rationale: To properly handle shipping price display logic and support free shipping scenarios

decisions.what: Hide payment anxiety banner for Click & Collect flow
decisions.rationale: Payment anxiety messaging not relevant for Click & Collect checkout experience

decisions.what: Redirect unregistered users from legacy FactorForm to Shopify FactorForm
decisions.rationale: Consolidate user registration flow to Shopify platform

decisions.what: Add validation to prevent OTP from being added by default
decisions.rationale: Hotfix to ensure OTP is only added when explicitly selected by user

refactors.reason: Code quality improvement and test maintainability

refactors.area: Price logic and voucher code autoapply
refactors.reason: Fix voucher code autoapply behavior and improve price calculation logic
refactors.impact: Checkout pricing and voucher application flow

fixes.issue: OTP being added by default without user selection
Voucher code autoapply not working correctly
Padding issues between quick actions and divider in Green Dish
Reactivation page UI issues in Green Dish

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: Major OTP implementation, two-step login, and legacy to Shopify migration

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: OTP cart creation and banner copy updates

entities.name: Green Dish
entities.context: UI improvements including storage/prep steps, padding fixes, and reactivation page updates

entities.name: OTP (One-Time Purchase)
entities.context: Core feature being implemented across multiple brands with checkout, cart, and payment integration

entities.name: Contentful
entities.context: Content management system receiving new keys for nutrition and other content

entities.name: Shopify
entities.context: Target platform for FactorForm user registration migration

entities.name: Click & Collect (C@C)
entities.context: Payment anxiety banner hidden for this checkout flow

entities.name: Price Model
entities.context: Extended with Shipping interface to handle shipping price display logic

key_patterns: Feature flag or variation-based development (OTP variation users, checkout type parameters)
Multi-brand architecture with shared components being adapted per brand (Factor Form, Good Chop, Green Dish)
Gradual migration strategy from legacy systems to modern platforms (Shopify migration)
Contentful CMS integration for content management across brands
Hook-based React architecture for cart and checkout functionality
Ticket-driven development with clear Jira references (TPT, GOC, RTEVMS, MIO prefixes)
Test quality focus with refactoring and unquarantining of tests
